contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Roman emperor | name =Priscus Attalus | full name = | title =[[Roman usurper|Usurper]] of the [[Western Roman Empire]] | image= Priscus Attalus Siliqua.jpg | caption =Coin of Priscus Attalus. | reign =409 and 414-415, against [[Honorius (emperor)|Honorius]] | predecessor = | successor = | death_date =after 416 | death_place =[[Lipari Islands]] |}} '''Priscus Attalus''' (d. after 416) was twice [[Roman usurper]] (in 409 and in 414), against [[Roman Emperor|Emperor]] [[Honorius (emperor)|Honorius]], with [[Visigoths|Visigothic]] support. Priscus Attalus was a Greek from Asia whose father had moved to Italy under Valentinian I. Attalus was an important [[Roman Senate|senator]] in [[Roman Empire|Rome]], who served as ''[[praefectus urbi]]'' in 409. He was twice proclaimed emperor by the [[Visigoths]], in an effort to impose their terms on the ineffectual Emperor [[Honorius (emperor)|Honorius]], in [[Ravenna]]. He held the title of Emperor in Rome, during 409, and later in [[Bordeaux]] in 414. His two reigns lasted only a few months; the first one ended when [[Alaric I|Alaric]] believed it was hampering his negotiations with Honorius, and the second came to an end after he was abandoned by the Visigoths and eventually captured by Honorius' men. Attalus was obliged to participate in the [[Roman Triumph|triumph]] Honorius celebrated in the streets of Rome in 416, before finishing his days exiled in the [[Lipari Islands]]. == External links == {{Commons-inline|Priscus Attalus}} * [http://www.roman-emperors.org/westemp5.htm#Note%205 Elton, Hugh, "Attalus (409-410, 414-415 A.D.)", ''De Imperatoribus Romanis''] {{s-start}} {{s-bef | before= [[Gabinius Barbarus Pompeianus]] }} {{s-ttl | title= [[List of urban prefects of Rome|''Praefectus urbi'' of Rome]] | years= 409 }} {{s-aft | after= [[Marcianus (praefectus urbi)|Marcianus]] }} {{end}} {{Roman Emperors}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Attalus, Priscus | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = [[Roman usurper]] and [[Roman Senate]] | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = [[Lipari Islands]] }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Attalus, Priscus}} [[Category:5th-century deaths]] [[Category:5th-century Roman usurpers]] [[Category:Roman emperors]] [[Category:Urban prefects of Rome]] [[Category:Year of birth unknown]]
